The workaround is to use ALT+SHIFT+Q Q

PW

I20070206-0010
PW

Paul, the code change you introduced to fix this defect end up breaking the legacy FastView handling. Now, selecting 'Other...' from the FastViewBar no longer opens the view as a fst view.

The problem is that the 'ShowViewHandler' used to be constructed with an argument 'makefast' to indicate that the new view should be opened as a fast view but the new code uses a default constructor, leaving the value as 'false'.

Let's get together and see what we should do...makring as RC1 to keep it on the radar.

Created an attachment (id=66910)
Show View menu v01

Add the make fast optional parameter to the show view command

If I provide a "values" class, I can double the number of show view entries in the keys preference page (which is what happens now).

If I don't, then you cannot define the fastview versions of those commands (although you cannot in the current system).

PW
Created an attachment (id=66992)
Show View menu v02

I respun the patch without an object providing "values".
PW
Released to HEAD >20070513
